p: Community-based HTS provided on a mobile basis or at stand-alone centres provide a different service offering from the existing public health facilities. Mobile services are provided from a mobile van and ‘pop-up’ tents, set up in public spaces. Stand-alone centres are fixed premises, but not attached to a health facility. Both mobile and stand-alone centres only provide HIV testing and related health services. Public health facilities offer a wider range of health services from fixed sites. Mobile services reach different populations compared to facility-based services; they are more likely to reach males [ 13], youth (≤25 years) [ 14] and older individuals (≥31 years) [ 15][ 16]. Compared to mobile services, stand-alone services have a higher proportion of individuals who test HIV positive [ 17] [ 18].
